original: Falkemo, Kurt M^auritz, förste stadsläkare, Oskarshamn, f. 19/7/89 i Västervik. G. 19 m. Torborg Ekbom. Barn: Curt f. 20, civ :ing., Sthdm, Britt 24, g. m. teknolog C. A. Björkstedt, Sthilm. — Stud:ex. i Linköp. 10, med. kand. i Upps. 15, med. lic. i Sthlm 19. Stud:resa t. Tysklli. 22. E. läk. v. centiraMäng. à Långholmen 18, tf. und:läk. v. Värml. 1. sanat. i Arvika 19, bitr. läk. v. Gbgs epid:sjukh. 20-21, und:läk. o. tf. las :läk. v. Varbergs las. 21, bitr. läk. o. tf. förest, v. Sàhlgr. sjukh. röntgenavd. 21-22, andre stadsläk. i Oskarshamn 22-30, förste dito sed. 30, läk. v. folks k. i Oskarshamn sed. 23, v. epid :sj’ukh. sed. 27, v. Ö. Smål. Jårnv. sed. 32. Ordf. i hälsov:ndn sed. 33 o. i las:direkt. sed. 35. Utg. skr. om blyförgiftning. Hobby: segling.
translated: Falkemo, Kurt Mauritz, first city doctor in Oskarshamn, born on July 19, 1889, in Västervik. Married in 1919 to Torborg Ekbom. Children: Curt, born in 1920, a civil engineer in Stockholm, and Britt, born in 1924, married to technologist C. A. Björkstedt in Stockholm. Completed his high school education in Linköping in 1910, received his Bachelor of Medicine in Uppsala in 1915, and his Medical License in Stockholm in 1919. Went on a study trip to Germany in 1922. Began his medical career as a resident doctor at Centira Mängsgård in Långholmen in 1918, then became acting assistant doctor at Värmland County Hospital in 1919, and deputy doctor and acting chief at Varberg County Hospital in 1921. Became assistant doctor and acting head of the radiology department at Sàhlgr. Hospital in 1921-22, then second city doctor in Oskarshamn from 1922-30, and first city doctor from 1930. Also worked as a doctor for public health in Oskarshamn from 1923 and for the epidemic hospital from 1927, and for the Ö. Smål. Railway from 1932. Chairman of the Health Committee from 1933 and the County Hospital Board from 1935. Published writings about lead poisoning. Hobby: sailing.
